title: is there mentioned who Sett dad is?
body:
in the comms for SEtt interactions people were saying Darius is his dad so I serached and apparently
https://i.imgur.com/pQ4cArb.png
Draven is his dad!?

Not gonna lie, I think his dad is just an random noxian, not an champion but I was curious if anyone have any more clues about his dad history/identity, how did he end to fuck an vastaya, considering if a noxian passed ever in Ionia that would be to do a massacre.

Draven is not Sett's dad.

> [{quoted}](name=SkiptoMyLuo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kgp5ZQbE,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-12-12T23:30:44.289+0000)

What type of Vastaya is his mother, both in class and animal species?
He has the same exact look as Xayah.
His mother was not a Lhotlan vastaya.

> [{quoted}](name=Yordle Gunner,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kgp5ZQbE,comment-id=000500010000,timestamp=2019-12-13T00:27:11.136+0000)

those look more like cat or maybe dog ears than bird.
Lmaoo first of all, birds don’t have protruding ears period.
But Xayah DOES have very long ears.

> [{quoted}](name=TOKYO AKALI,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kgp5ZQbE,comment-id=00050001000000010001,timestamp=2019-12-13T11:02:17.411+0000)
>
> Lmaoo first of all, birds don’t have protruding ears period.

Not literal ears, but some, particularly owls, have head tufts that look like ears, like Xayah and Rakan.
Reav3 apparently confirmed on Reddit that Sett is a Wolverine.

And if you just look up his name, you get a link to the definition of "sett:"

>A system of tunnels that is home to a badger.

It's like naming a jackalope Warren.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kgp5ZQbE,comment-id=00050001000000010000,timestamp=2019-12-13T05:41:53.923+0000)

I can see it. Matches his character too.
X-men origins: Sett.

"Because, obviously, Sett is the daddy." - heartcored

I was hoping Setts dad was also Yasuos dad.

Yasuo got the dashing from his daddy.

can we have a voice line for Draven saying "Tell your mom I said hi." after Sett says his Noxian line about his dad for the BM flavor then? Also Brand needs to have the best taunt responses in game PERIOD. You know why too, sick burns.

To clarify why Alistar and Draven are in Sett's related champions, all 3 are(or were) members of fighting rings in their respective regions. Alistar and Draven are/were in The Fleshing in Noxus, and Sett is in a fighting ring in Ionia. That's literally the only connection between any of them.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kgp5ZQbE,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-12-12T23:37:08.797+0000)
>
> To clarify why Alistar and Draven are in Sett's related champions, all 3 are(or were) members of fighting rings in their respective regions. Alistar and Draven are/were in The Fleshing in Noxus, and Sett is in a fighting ring in Ionia. That's literally the only connection between any of them.

What are you talking about? Brawlers from different fighting pits are connected by the fact that they're all fighting pit brawlers?? Preposterous. Sett is obviously Alistar and Draven's love child. The picture we see Sett pull out in his joke is just Alistar with face paint and a wig. That's the true reason for them being in his related champions list smh.

I don't think Draven is Sett's father. I just don't think the timing is right. Draven was never involved in Ionia so far as we know and his executioner job is what gained him fame. I think he is less a pit fighter and more someone who turned execution into an entertaining event to gain fame. I think Draven probably does have involvement with other pit fighters, same as he has Alistar as a related Champion, Alistar being related to pit fighting as well. 

I guess its not impossible, but Sett's father also hung around for awhile after Sett's birth. He has a vague memory of his father, meaning he was old enough to form memories, probably 3-5 years old. Not only do I not think Draven is the type to hang around with a newly formed family for that long, but again, we have no information of him ever being involved with Ionia, let alone 3-5+ years.

> [{quoted}](name=AbiwonKenabi,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=kgp5ZQbE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-12-12T17:16:32.044+0000)
>
> I don't think Draven is Sett's father. I just don't think the timing is right. Draven was never involved in Ionia so far as we know and his executioner job is what gained him fame. I think he is less a pit fighter and more someone who turned execution into an entertaining event to gain fame. I think Draven probably does have involvement with other pit fighters, same as he has Alistar as a related Champion, Alistar being related to pit fighting as well. 
> 
> I guess its not impossible, but Sett's father also hung around for awhile after Sett's birth. He has a vague memory of his father, meaning he was old enough to form memories, probably 3-5 years old. Not only do I not think Draven is the type to hang around with a newly formed family for that long, but again, we have no information of him ever being involved with Ionia, let alone 3-5+ years.

Another thing to bring up: wasn't Urgot's mission to Zaun and him being betrayed and left there only after the Ionian war, since it was Swain's doing? Draven only replaced him as executioner around that time. So I'm pretty sure that makes it clear that Draven is not his father.

Its not confirmed.

But considering that: 

A) Draven appears in "Related Champions" in the Universe page of Sett (It could be explained that he is also a fighter of the Noxian Arenas, just like Alistar) 
B) Draven is Noxian, just like his father.
C) Draven is a pitfighter, just like his father.
D) Draven is the kind of person who would leave everything for fame.
E) Draven is famous, and his father left in order to become famous.

It makes sense to think that he is the father, or at least that Draven would know his father.

Also, Draven wears a white fur like thing arround his neck... that is kinda similar to the "fur" of Sett... but that could be another cointidence.

it made, but Draven always spent his childhood in Noxus with Darius and that girl that Darius had a crush on.
He become famous as an executioner, so I'm doubting he leaves Noxus very often if ever, most of his jobs seems to be inside the country, an the only people he entertain are noxians probably.
I can't really imagine what he would do outside the country. 
Sett is in Ionia with his mom so it is not very probably that Draven randomly pick up her in Noxus and Sett decided to leave the country, and I doubt any Ionian would come to Noxus in first place, so if her mom wouldn't be member of a vastaya tribe she wouldn't probably stay in Ionia in first place, especially if she is affilied with noxians people wouldn't accept her there. I mean, they got expelled just for being impregnat by an human, imagine how good would be their relationship in the country if she would've travel to Noxus or come here from Noxus.

Also Sett dad didn't leaved instantly, he spent some good time with his mom after concepting him.

edit: also very unsignifiant but on Draven bio there's just swain (apparently swain and draven were good friends before Darius return when Swain planned his attack on throne) and darius which are related to him, while on other champs (like lux for example) are at least 3 champions

The thing about this theory is that Draven became the famous executioner after leaving Ionia.

I guess that the Timeline would be like this:

1) Draven is born in the port city of Basilich. Darius takes care of his little Brother after they became orphans.
 _Notice that Baslich is a port city and they were Orphans. Noxus used to send Orphans to the war_
2) Darius goes to Freljord to fight for Noxus without knowing that Quiletta was going to have babies, Draven in other hand goes to Ionia. 
_Why do i say that Draven went to Ionia? Well, because i suppose that, in that place, is where he meet Swain, lets remember that Draven was one of the allies of Swain, when the birdman killed Darkwill, and Swain participated in the Ionian War... It would make sense that the rest of his allies participated in that war as well _
3) So, Draven, "seeking greatness in the Noxian military", joins the army and goes to Ionia (or is send as a Child Soldier like Kayn and Riven) in order to conquer some Ionian territories (Like Fae Lor). During that time, Draven meets a Vastaya and has a child with her. _It is important to mention that there are territories of Ionia that are part of the Noxian Empire._ So, even if the Ionians were not happy with Draven, the Female Vastaya and Sett, they had to accept them because, well, Noxus rules that part of Ionia.

https://i.imgur.com/hcfU6kO.png (The red X is Basilich)

 So, in theory, Draven was in Noxian territory when he lived with the mother of Sett. There, he sees a better method to share ''Draven'' with the world (The lore literally says "world", no just Noxus), the arenas where he decides to work as a pitfighter, killing Ionian prisoners (after all, it would make little sense to think that Noxus would send the prisoners from Ionia to Noxus, just to kill them).
4) After a many years (as said in the Bio of Swain), Swain prepares a bunch of allies (Including Draven) in order to defeat Darkwill. _Maybe Swain promised him the fame that Draven wanted or something like that._ 
5) So, Draven goes back to the Inmortal Bastion and helps Swain in order to get the fame that he wants.
6) Darius returns to the Inmortal Bastion and finds out that Swain took over Noxus with the help of Draven.
7) Draven keep fighting in the arenas as a pitfighter, but now in the Inmortal Bastion.
8) He finally becomes the Glorious Executioner after Urgot is send to Zaun.
9) Darius goes back no Freljord to fight for Noxus, during that time, the son of Quiletta (and Darius) dies.
10) Darius returns to Noxus, and his comic happens, The Wispering Doodad happens after that.
11) Sett becomes the boss of the ionian arenas.
He is not, his father must be a warmason
I'm just happy we are done with Draven not being his dad. just a dumb assumption in my opinion.

Sett is for sure similar to Draven in attitude, I could see them hanging out or Sett looking up to Draven as a Role model. 

Sett's daddy is for sure a Fighter/Bruiser though, I could see something like a Udyr being his Daddy (i don't know a lot about lore or anything) since he fills some criteria and it also would explain why he got with a Bird Chick or whatever 

Am I close?

p.s. he is one of the few males in the game (Jax as well) who i could see sticking around for a little before going off to fight, all the other males for the most part are extremely bad or good, no in between

... How old would this make Draven, if that were the case?

Probably a heck of a lot older than he is

Scathlocke says it's not Draven, and when he confirms something like that, it was usually already there and he just clarifies what the lore says.
Here, the timing simply does not match. 
https://twitter.com/LaurieGoulding/status/1205235767485714432

Actually Sett's dad is Vladimir. If you look Vladimir story's he's joined a Noxus court for a wild time and she's leave and do a "solo warrior". " In the past, he deigned to join the Noxian noble courts during the most interesting of times, only to fade into seclusion decades later, his extreme age—and the atrocities his sorcery could wreak—a well-kept secret. Even so, under Vladimir’s tutelage, the art of hemomancy has found a place in the military of Noxus, and among scions of the old aristocracy."

Even so, under Vladimir’s tutelage, the art of hemomancy has found a place in the military of Noxus, and among scions of the old aristocracy."
